SEARCH
Module JBubbleBobble
Package game.model.user

Class UserMethods

java.lang.Object
game.model.user.UserMethods
public class UserMethods extends Object
The UserMethods class provides static methods for handling user data, such as reading user scores from files and saving user information. It also manages the last active user.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserMethods

      public UserMethods()

  • Method Details

    • getUsersData

      public static HashMap<String,List<Integer>> getUsersData()
      Reads all user data from the directory "resources/users/" and returns it as a HashMap.
      Returns:
      a HashMap where the keys are usernames and the values are lists of integers representing the user's scores.

    • saveUsersData

      public static void saveUsersData(String nickname, int highScore, int gamesPlayed, int gamesWon, int gamesLost)
      Saves user data such as high score, games played, games won, and games lost to a file.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the username to save data for.
      highScore - the user's high score.
      gamesPlayed - the total number of games the user has played.
      gamesWon - the total number of games the user has won.
      gamesLost - the total number of games the user has lost.

    • saveLastUser

      public static void saveLastUser(User user)
      Saves the last user that was active.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object representing the last active user.

    • getLastUser

      public static String getLastUser(String path)
      Reads and returns the nickname of the last active user from the specified file path.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the file that stores the last active user.
      Returns:
      the nickname of the last active user, or null if no user was found.
